body_html:
Actually, it seems some scenarios are not covered by use_locking=True.

If a.assign_add(b, use_locking=True) gets evaluated while c.assign(a, use_locking=True) is executing, then c will end up with partially updated value.

Updated gist with experiment
https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/3a53132dcddc8ff47e4e919579b98c6a

Actually, it seems some scenarios are not covered by use_locking=True.
If a.assign_add(b, use_locking=True) gets evaluated while c.assign(a, use_locking=True) is executing, then c will end up with partially updated value.

body:
Actually, it seems some scenarios are not covered by `use_locking=True`.

If `a.assign_add(b, use_locking=True)` gets evaluated while `c.assign(a, use_locking=True)` is executing, then `c` will end up with partially updated value.

Updated gist with experiment 
https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/3a53132dcddc8ff47e4e919579b98c6a
